servinfo.title: DTC P0116: Engine Coolant Temperature Circuit Range / Performance

servinfosub.title: DTC Detecting Condition and Trouble Area

entry.ptxt: ECT sensor values is less than –10 °C, 14 °F (for M16A engine) or –5 °C, 23 °F (for J20A engine) while engine is running under more than specified engine load (more than 1000 rpm) for 2 to 1116 min (depending on ECT at engine start) continuously from engine start.

item.ptxt: When performing a road test, select a place where there is no traffic or possibility of a traffic accident and be very careful during testing to avoid occurrence of an accident.
Road test should be carried out by 2 persons, a driver and tester, on a level road.

attention3.ptxt: Check to make sure that following conditions are satisfied when using this “DTC Confirmation Procedure”.

item.ptxt: Intake air temperature at engine start: –10 °C (14 °F) to 80 °C (176 °F)
Altitude (barometric pressure): 2400 m, 8000 ft or less (560 mmHg, 75 kPa or more)

s1.ptxt: With ignition switch turned OFF, connect scan tool.
Turn ON ignition switch, clear DTC.
Drive vehicle at 40 mph (60 km/h) or higher for 20 min. or more.

attention3.ptxt: Before this trouble shooting is performed, read the precautions for DTC troubleshooting referring to Precautions for DTC Troubleshooting:M16A and J20A .

testgroup.question: Was “Engine and Emission Control System Check” performed?

action.ptxt: Go to Engine and Emission Control System Check:M16A and J20A .

test1.ptxt: With ignition switch turned OFF, install scan tool to DLC.
Turn ON ignition switch and check DTC with scan tool.

action.ptxt: Go to DTC P0118: Engine Coolant Temperature Circuit High:M16A and J20A .

testgroup.title: Engine coolant temp. check

test1.ptxt: Turn ON ignition switch and check engine coolant temp. displayed on scan tool.
Warm up engine to normal operating temp. and check engine coolant temp. displayed on scan tool.

testgroup.question: Does engine coolant temp. vary more than 1 °C (1 °F) and rise higher than 70 °C (158 °F)?

paragroup.ptxt: Check for intermittent referring to Intermittent and Poor Connection Inspection .

testgroup.title: Thermostat check
testgroup.question: Is there a symptom due to thermostat remaining open (it takes a long time before vehicle heater becomes effective or before engine is warmed to normal operating temp., etc.)?

action.ptxt: Check thermostat referring to Thermostat Inspection:M16A and J20A .

test1.ptxt: Disconnect ECT sensor connector with ignition switch turned OFF.
Check for proper connection to ECT sensor connector at “PPL/YEL” and “GRY/GRN” wire terminals.
If OK, then with ignition switch ON, measure voltage between “PPL/YEL” wire terminal of ECT sensor connector and vehicle body ground.
Turn OFF ignition switch.
Remove ECM from its bracket with ECM connectors connected.
Check for proper connection of ECM connector at “C37-24” terminal.
If OK, then turn ON ignition switch, measure voltage between “C37-24” terminal of ECM connector and vehicle body ground.

paragroup.ptxt: If wire and connection are OK, go to Step 7.

test1.ptxt: Disconnect connectors from ECM with ignition switch turned OFF.
Turn ignition switch to ON position.
Measure voltage between “PPL/YEL” wire terminal of ECT sensor connector and body ground.

paragroup.ptxt: “PPL/YEL” wire is shorted to other circuit.
If wire is OK, substitute a known-good ECM and recheck.

test1.ptxt: Measure resistance between “C37-24” terminal of ECM connector and “PPL/YEL” wire terminal of ECT sensor connector with ignition switch turned OFF.
Connect connectors to ECM.
Check for proper connection of ECT sensor connector at “GRY/GRN” wire terminal.
Measure resistance between “GRY/GRN” wire terminal of ECT sensor connector and vehicle body ground.
Remove ECM from its bracket with ECM connectors connected.
Measure resistance between “C37-57” terminal of ECM connector and vehicle body ground.

paragroup.ptxt: If circuit is OK, substitute a known-good ECM and recheck.

test1.ptxt: Check ECT sensor according to Engine Coolant Temperature (ECT) Sensor Inspection:M16A and J20A .

action.ptxt: Substitute a known-good ECM and recheck.
